isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - REAR WINDOW GLASS ON VEHICLES WITH obstructed access from the outside

svcproc.title: REAR WINDOW GLASS ON VEHICLES WITH obstructed access from the outside

svcsubproc.title: Install Rear Window Glass on Vehicles with Obstructed access from the Outside on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

important.para: To install rear window glass you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has a tool box that includes the tools required to remove and install bonded rear window glass. To order, call toll free in U. S. and Canada 1-800-520-2584 or Fax 1-800-578-7375. NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.

svcsubproc.para: To install rear window glass, you will also need the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 147) . The kit includes:

item.para: U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

svcsubproc.para: These materials must be used on or before expiration date marked on container. U413 Fence Primer, U401 Glass Prep and U402 Glass Primer have a 6 month shelf life. U216 Urethane adhesive A and Curative B tubes have a 9 month shelf life.
In addition to the items supplied in the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 147) above, you will need the following materials:

item.para: Applicator nozzles supplied by Essex® to puncture U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

note.para: Use only heat treated glass (AS-2 per ANSI Z26.1-Latest revision).

warning.para: Wear protective work gloves when handling the rear window glass. Also wear appropriate protective gloves when using any of the Betaseal system chemicals from the Essex® windshield installation kit.

note.para: Before installing new rear window glass, wipe off any water remaining around rear window fence and surrounding cab area with a lint free cloth.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 17 for Items in parentheses.

To install a rear window glass onto a vehicle with a van body, you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has two special suction cups (Item 1) and a slide rail (Item 2), which will need to be assembled. They are required to remove and install the bonded rear window glass from between the cab and the van body.

step1.para: Before preparing the rear window fence for installing rear window glass, dry fit new rear window glass as follows.
Dry fit new rear window glass on vehicle to make sure the glass fits rear window opening properly before applying U216 adhesive.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 183 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Carefully place rear window glass (Item 1) on the slide rail (Item 2) with the proper side facing the back of the cab.

figure.caption: Figure 183. Place Rear Window Glass on Slide Rail for Dry Fit

step1.para: Slide rear window glass (Item 1, Figure 184) on the slide rail (Item 2, Figure 184) between the back of the cab and the van body. Lean the top of rear window glass against the van body.

figure.caption: Figure 184. Slide Rear Window Glass on Slide Rail for Dry Fit

step1.para: Place two suction cups (Item 1, Figure 185) on the rear window glass (Item 2, Figure 185) as it sits on the slide rail between the back of the cab and the van body. With the suction cup placed against the rear window glass, repeatedly push plunger until the red line (Item 7, Figure 17) on the plunger is not visible.

figure.caption: Figure 185. Install Suction Cups on Rear Window Glass for Dry Fit

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 186 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place a piece of tape (Item 1) at the bottom center of the rear window opening on the back trim panel (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 186. Applying Tape on Back Trim Panel for Dry Fit of Rear Window Glass

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 181 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Using the two suction cups (Item 1, Figure 187), lift the rear window glass (Item 2, Figure 187) off the slide rail between the back of the cab and the van body. Position lower window glass locator tabs (Item 5) between window locators (Item 6) of lower window fence of cab. Make sure upper window glass spring clip (Item 7) is inside top of window fence (Item 8).

figure.caption: Figure 187. Install Rear Window Glass for Dry Fit

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 188 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using the two suction cups (Item 1), hold the rear window glass (Item 2) in the proper place in the rear window opening.

figure.caption: Figure 188. Rear Window Glass Held in Place at Dry Fit

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 189 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: While holding the rear window glass (Item 1) in the proper place in the rear window opening. Use a marker and mark a line (Item 2) in line with both right and left sides of the tape (Item 3). These lines will help align the rear window glass during installation.

figure.caption: Figure 189. Mark Rear Window Glass at Dry Fit

step1.para: Using the suction cups, tilt the top of rear window glass out. Lift the rear window glass off window glass fence and place it in the slide rail. Lean the top of rear window glass against the van body.
Use the suction cups to slide the rear window glass down the slide rail enough to grab the rear window glass from outside the cab.
Remove the suction cups from the rear window glass.
Remove new rear window glass from slide rail and place it on a suitable padded work stand to prepare it for installation.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 190 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove urethane adhesive (Item 1) from rear window fence (Item 2) around window opening with a utility knife (Item 3) and/or power knife with short inside cutting blade (Item 4). A thin layer of old urethane adhesive of 2 to 3 mm thick may be left on window fence. Try to keep a consistent thickness of old urethane adhesive around the perimeter of the window fence.

figure.caption: Figure 190. Removing Urethane Adhesive from Rear Window Fence

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. POWER KNIFE WITH SHORT INSIDE CUTTING BLADE

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 169 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Clean dirt and any water left from spraying around rear window glass during removal, off rear window fence (Item 1) with a brush or clean, lint free cloth (Item 2) before installing new rear window glass.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 191 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place strips of tape (Item 1) around the rear window opening (Item 2) to protect the painted surfaces while applying U413 window fence primer from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 1, Figure 147) .

figure.caption: Figure 191. Taping Rear Window Opening

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 150 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Take U413 window fence primer from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 1, Figure 147) . Shake U413 window fence primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 192 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U413 window fence primer (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to cover scratches and bare metal on rear window fence (Item 3). DO NOT apply U413 window fence primer over old urethane adhesive left on rear window fence.

figure.caption: Figure 192. Applying Window Fence Primer to Rear Window Glass Fence

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 193 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove strips of tape (Item 1) from around the rear window opening (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Remove Tape from Around Rear Window Opening

step1.para: Allow U413 window fence primer to dry for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.
With new rear window glass on a padded work stand, prepare rear window glass for installation as follows:

Using a razor blade if necessary, and plastic scrubbing pad, remove any encapsulation flash from bonding surface of new rear window glass. Clean new rear window glass thoroughly with Essex® glass cleaner GC800. Dry thoroughly with paper towels. Make sure rear window glass is completely clean and dry before proceeding (Figure 171) .

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 150 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once the new rear window glass has been cleaned, take U401 window glass prep from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 2, Figure 147) . Shake U401 window glass prep (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

note.para: Read completely through Step 24 below to ensure the correct application and removal of the window glass prep U401.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 172 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U401 window glass prep (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface only on new rear window glass (Item 3). If applied to clear glass surface, glass will haze. Immediately wipe glass prep off by following eight to ten inches behind the applicator with a white or brown paper towel (Item 4). DO NOT use a cloth shop towel. After completing first application of glass prep, repeat glass prep application and removal process. This is a clear liquid.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 150 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once U401 window glass prep has been applied and wiped off new rear window glass, take U402 window glass primer from Essex® windshield installation kit (Item 3, Figure 147) . Shake U402 window glass primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 173 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U402 window glass primer (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface on new rear window glass (Item 3).
Allow U402 window glass primer to dry to a tack free condition for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.

caution.para: Once the rear window glass has been primed, ensure there is no contact with bonding surface as oil from skin will affect bonding performance. If the rear window glass is not bonded properly, the cab strength and safety would be compromised. If contact with bonding surface has occurred, repeat the cleaning process and reapply U402 window glass primer and allow it to dry for 6 to 10 minutes before applying U216 adhesive.

step1.para: Remove Essex® U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B) from Essex® windshield installation kit (Items 4 and 5, Figure 147) .

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 174 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using the pull tab or a screwdriver (Item 1), if pull tab not supplied, pry out bottom cover (Item 2) from both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 175 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Use one applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture adhesive A tube (Item 2). Use the other applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture curative B tube (Item 2). DO NOT use the same applicator nozzle to puncture both tubes; this keeps from contaminating the other tube before installing application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 147) i. Be sure to push applicator nozzle all the way in to ensure adhesive tubes are fully opened.
Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 2) have been prepared for use, remove application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 147) from Essex® windshield installation kit.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 176 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) on mixing head (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 177 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) are installed on mixing head (Item 2), remove applicator nozzle (Item 7, Figure 147) from Essex® windshield installation kit. Install applicator nozzle (Item 3) on mixing head (Item 2). Cut tab (Item 4) off applicator nozzle.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 178 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before loading adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) into betagun (Item 2), pull trigger and run plungers (Item 3) all the way back to allow for adhesive tubes to be loaded. Open front cover (Item 4) on betagun and install adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle into betagun.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 179 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once adhesive tubes with mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) have been installed into betagun (Item 2), close front cover (Item 3). Run plungers (Item 4) forward on betagun until plungers are in position to apply adhesive. Stop when adhesive reaches applicator nozzle.

note.para: Application of adhesive bead on new rear window glass shall be 0 to 2 mm from encapsulation edge and be at least 5/8 to 3/4 inch (15 to 20 mm) high and 3/8 to 1/2 inch (8 to 12 mm) wide maximum.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 180 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Hold betagun (Item 1) and applicator nozzle (Item 2) as close to a 90 degree angle as possible and start at the center of the bottom edge of rear window glass. Going across the bottom in either direction, pull trigger to apply a uniform bead of adhesive (Item 3) all the way around rear window glass. The harder you pull the trigger the faster the adhesive will extrude. Use this variable speed control to slow down as you apply adhesive around the corners. Overlap adhesive at the seam slightly, and use a plastic or wood tongue depressor (Item 4) to smooth or even out adhesive as required before installing rear window glass.

Once adhesive has been applied on rear window glass it MUST be installed within 5 to 7 minutes maximum. Adhesive starts curing immediately and will not provide an adequate bond if not installed within the 5 to 7 minute time frame.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 194 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using the two suction cups (Item 1), place rear window glass (Item 2) onto slide rail, remove the one suction cup nearest the cab and slide rear window glass down the slide rail using the other suction cup (Item 1). Remove the other suction cup.

figure.caption: Figure 194. Place Rear Window Glass with Adhesive onto Slide Rail

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 195 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From inside the cab, install the two suction cups (Item 1) onto the inside of the rear window glass (Item 2). With the suction cup placed against the rear window glass, repeatedly push plunger until the red line (Item 7, Figure 17) on the plunger is not visible.

figure.caption: Figure 195. Install Suction Cups on Rear Window Glass

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 181 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Using the two suction cups (Item 1, Figure 196) on the rear window glass (Item 2, Figure 196), lift the rear window glass off the slide rail and using the alignment lines at the bottom of the glass, position lower window glass locator tabs (Item 5) between window locators (Item 6) of lower window fence of cab. Once the bottom of the rear window glass is in the proper position on the bottom of the rear window fence, carefully pull the rear window glass into position at the top and make sure that the upper window glass spring clip (Item 7) fits inside upper window fence (Item 8). Pull the rear window glass in against the rear window fence as evenly as possible.

figure.caption: Figure 196. Install Rear Window Glass with Adhesive into Window Opening

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 197 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the two suction cups (Item 1) from the rear window glass (Item 2).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Remove Suction Cups from Rear Window Glass

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 198 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Reach in between back of cab and van body, and from both sides, gently push on rear window glass all around outer edge to set it properly against window fence.

figure.caption: Figure 198. Pushing on Rear Window Glass to Properly Set it Against Window Fence

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 199 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove pin (Item 1) from slide rail (Item 2) and the hole in the block (Item 3) of the suction cup (Item 4), to allow the slide rail to be removed from the suction cup, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 199. Remove Pin from Slide Rail and Suction Cup Block on Driver Side

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 200 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove pin (Item 1) from slide rail (Item 2) and the hole in the block (Item 3) of the suction cup (Item 4), to allow the slide rail to be removed from the suction cup, passenger side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 200. Remove Pin from Slide Rail and Suction Cup Block on Passenger Side

step1.para: Once both driver and passenger side pins (Item 1) have been removed from the slide rail (Item 2) and the block (Item 3) on each suction cup (Item 4).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 201 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the slide rail (Item 1) from between the cab and the back of the van body.

figure.caption: Figure 201. Remove Slide Rail from between the Cab and Van Body

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 202 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the suction cup on drive side (Item 1) and suction cup on passenger side (Item 2) from the back of the van body.

figure.caption: Figure 202. Remove Suction Cups on Van Body

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 201 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: It is not necessary to disassemble the slide rail (Item 1) if there is space available to store it assembled, once the job is completed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 17 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If it is desired to store the slide rail (Item 2) back in the removal and installation kit. Remove four wing nuts (Item 6) from underneath the bottom rail (Item 4) and remove four flat head screws (Item 5) from the two top rails (Item 3). It can now be stored in the removal and installation kit

If removed during rear window glass removal, install the seats back into the cab. Refer to
SEATS
. For installing driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing two man fixed bench seat without tool box, refer to Install Two Man Fixed Bench Seat without Tool Box on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing two man fixed bench seat with tool box, refer to Install Two Man Fixed Bench Seat with Tool Box on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing full width rear bench seat , refer to Install Full Width Rear Bench Seat on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

caution.para: Be careful while putting the seats back into the cab, not to hit the rear window glass while the adhesive is curing. This may cause rear window glass to not seal properly and could cause leaking.

important.para: The quick curing time of U216 two part urethane adhesive allows the vehicle to be driven 30 minutes after completing rear window glass installation. You will need to use the area on the Form Bonded Windshield Replacement Report (Figure 225) to record Time, Temperature and Humidity.
